{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child has a vascular plaque along the ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve, which has been present since birth. This is a characteristic feature of Sturge Weber syndrome, which is also associated with seizure disorders. The other options, such as Infantile hemangioma, Congenital hemangioma, and Proteus syndrome, do not typically present with these specific features.", "answer_choice": "A"}
